channel.title: Vertigo Radio Live
channel.itunes:author: Devin Vertigo
channel.description: Vertigo Radio Live has been a labor of love for Devin Vertigo and his colleagues for nearly seven years. in 2008, MeVIO gave us a platform and we ran with it. Now, Vertigo Radio Live comes to you every single week, bringing you alternative news. Ranging from cyborgs to censorship, Vertigo Radio Live is a humorous round table discussion that looks at the news that you didn't know you needed to know. Releases every Tuesday morning on various platforms. Don't forget to check out our offers from Mevio Offers! Vertigo Radio Live is a round table discussion show that uses humor to impart serious messages. Focusing on alternative news, technology, the paranormal,and rights and freedoms, Vertigo Radio Live comes to you every week with something new and different. Hosted by Devin Vertigo and his colleagues, the show aims to bring you the news you didn't know you needed to know. 2 hours every week on Mevio, RantRadio Talk, Osprey Networks, and RoundTable Radio.net

As a user of their MozyHome product, I, Devin Vertigo, will say that there services work extraordianarily well and offer great options, such as batch backups of certain folders (customizable of course) or just single file or directory backups. They also offer the option to send that backup to any drive of your choice, so while you are able to back up your data to an offsite location, you can also back it up to an external drive onsite. As a user of their MozyHome product, I, Devin Vertigo, will say that there services work extraordianarily well and offer great options, such as batch backups of certain folders (customizable of course) or just single file or directory backups. They also offer the option to send that backup to any drive of your choice, so while you are able to back up your data to an offsite location, you can also back it up to an external drive onsite. Mozy Backup is a fantastic little program that will certainly become your one stop when it comes to backing up your data offsite! As a user of their MozyHome product, I, Devin Vertigo, will say that there services work extraordianarily well and offer great options, such as batch backups of certain folders (customizable of course) or just single file or directory backups. They also offer the option to send that backup to any drive of your choice, so while you are able to back up your data to an offsite location, you can also back it up to an external drive onsite. I will say that the initial backup can take time depending on your ISPs upload speed, but after that, backups are quick and painless, and restores are easy as anything I’ve experienced short of directly restoring from an FTP server! item.title: Vertigo Radio Live #65: Leonard Nimoy Hates Your Show
item.itunes:author: Devin Vertigo
item.description:
Art created by Christina Dufour

 

Devin Vertigo and the Amazing Ty were joined by Mecha Jesus on the latest episode of Vertigo Radio Live. They discussed cryo surgery, an honest debate about the Scott Pilgrim movie, the continuing role of robots in our lives, and finally, a controversial new bill that would place websites in the US on a blacklist if they were found to 'encourage copyright infringement.' The last thirty minutes is given strictly to this topic. Below is what was posted for that section, which was released separately on Friday Oct. 1st.

 

Contained in the last 30 minutes of this weeks show is the section wherein we discuss the pending Senate bill that would put into effect blacklists which may effect how a person in the United States may surf the web. You know, that thing that everyone has been throwing petitions around about. We here at Vertigo Media Network believe that it may be time to drop those petitions and actually stand up and do what so many have done for so many different reasons: fight for what you believe in. It may sound silly, but the internet created what this is, and has given Devin Vertigo in particular many opportunities over the years that otherwise would not be there. That being said, it seemed poignant to get this out to the fans before the actual release date of October 4th (Amazing Ty's birthday), to get your point of view.

 

If you have a passion for this, put down the petitions, contact your senators, and make it clear that you want the internet to remain without a blacklist. Yes, protecting someone’s intellectual property rights can be and is important, but you don't level a city block because one building needs to be demolished.

 

If you have an opinion on this bill, or what we have said so far, mail us an audio response by October 7th, or even a written one, and we will read/air it.
